awd_titl_txt: Evidence for a Temperate Climatic Belt in the Southern      Hemisphere of the Carboniferous Period
awd_abstract_narration: In the southern hemisphere of the Carboniferous Period two                 climatic belts have been recognized so far, based on their                      floras.  The tropical belt (Amerosinian or Euramerican floral                   realm) extended into the southern paleo-hemisphere.  The cool                   climatic zone (Gondwana floral realm) is known from fossil floras                                                                                               occurring several thousand kilometers away.  The temperate                      climatic zone has been missing.  Based on initial research with                 Prof. Alleman (Lima, Peru) it is proposed that the enigmatic                    Carboniferous flora from Paracas, Peru represents the southern                  temperate climatic belt.  In order to test this hypothesis PI                   will study fossil plants from two areas in Peru.  The results                   will refine the paleoclimatological model of the Carboniferous                  Period.

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: TRUSTEES OF THE UNIVERSITY OF PENNSYLVANIA, THE
